name: Alila Ubud

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was beautiful! Outstanding views across the valley, monkeys in the trees and wandering across the gardens and hundreds of stars at night. Very romantic!
reviews.title: Beautiful, relaxing & amazing food!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a basic room, but it was beautiful with a nice big comfortable bed and a balcony with a lounger on it. The bathroom was nicely done, with lovely products in it. Only negative about the room was the soundproofing - we got woken up by our neighbours twice.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The spa is gorgeous, we had full body massages, it was a beautiful setting and we got different teas when going in and coming out.
reviews.title: Highlight of our honeymoon!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: They do a lovely welcome chat when yu arrive, provide drinks and explain the set up of the hotel.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel - amazing food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant is amazing, the food is expensive but delicious, as is the breakfast. We booked a table for out on the terrace - bit of an error as it was pitch black and couldnt see what we were eating, so I would sit in the main bit.
reviews.title: Definately Relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had their upgraded villa (can't remember what it was called) immediately after our wedding in Bali (not the normal Bali bogan wedding, it cost $30k for 40 people, I feel the need to point that out so you don't judge me heh!). We stayed 3 nights and loved every minute.
reviews.title: Stunning, so beautiful, a luxurious and peaceful place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The villa we had was a little walk (a beautiful walk) away from the main area of the hotel, perched on the side of a mountain covered in jungle, with the (Ayung?) river flowing beneath us. When we arrived we had a resident monkey family visit us - they weren't the pushy scary types, but timid wild creatures. We also had adorable little squirrels running about outside on our balcony. In our villa, the bed was the centre of the main room, overlooking the jungle valley. Then you go through doors and step across a pond with little frogs and lillypads in it, into the wardrobe and vanity mirror area, then further along are his and her showers and bathrooms. Just a lovely, luxurious experience staying in this villa.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort, service could be better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool is gorgeous, although there aren't enough sun beds.
reviews.title: Honeymoon Heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had a romantic dinner for two served a little way into the jungle in this gorgeous little Balinese gazebo, with our own traiditional Rindik player, and the serving staff could not have been sweeter and more attentive, typical of the hospitality and care of the Balinese people- I unfortunately got a phone call during our delicious dinner that my precious kitten had been locked in our house without food or water for 6 days because the girl house sitting literally went walk-about (angry much?) - what ensued were many tears and frantic phone calls to get someone to rescue her. Our Balinese host was most distressed that we were so distraught and gave us free champagne and did everything he could to comfort us - I'm still moved by how much he cared.
reviews.title: Peaceful, Beautiful Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Anyway, other great thigns about this place:
reviews.title: Hot and cold, good and bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011
reviews.text: We stayed here in nov 2009, it was amazing, the infinity pool was great. Very good breakfast everything made to order. We had the best spa treatments ever while we were there. It is a little bit out of Ubud but there are regular shuttle buses into town. We booked a few trip through the hotel which were of a very high standard, the guides were very informative. The rooms were great itwas not very big but had eveything you needed with an outside shower it was just perfect. I hope to return again sometime.
reviews.title: Amazing Alila

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Alila Ubud from 20 to 23 January 2012. The hotel is situated away from the hustle and bustle of Ubud town and is about 20 minutes away by car.
reviews.title: Wonderful quiet hotel with beautiful view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although parts of it are under renovation, we were not disturbed by any noise.
reviews.title: In the middle of luxury and quietness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a deluxe room with an open air shower and bathroom. The room and toilet are clean. There was also a balcony in which we could relax. From the reviews on tripadvisor, we knew there was no TV and so requested for one in advance. Otherwise there should be an ipod with preloaded songs.
reviews.title: Fantastic honeymoon destination

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012
reviews.text: The breakfast was very good. The pool was not crowded when we were there (low season now).
reviews.title: Very nice hotel with amazing food!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While the Alila Ubud is stunningly beautiful with spectacular views it falls short of being a great place to stay. We were looking forward to four days of relaxation after traveling for a week and half. We ended up being so disappointed that we checked out two days early.
reviews.title: Surprisingly Disappointing

likes.liked: — The setting, view and watching the monkeys.
likes.disliked: — The location, service and being nickeld and dimed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unbeknownst to us, we were met by a driver from the Alila in our hotel in Seminyak upon check-out. We had not arranged for this pick-up and we were told that we had a complimentary one-way transfer. We hurriedly canceled the driver that we had pre-arranged the day before and off we went. When we arrived we were left standing at the lobby stairs met by no-one. After a few minutes, someone from the desk came over to check us in. Our first impression of the staff was unfriendly and slow which held to be true for the remainder of our stay. Not to mention that complimentary transfer cost usd$38.
reviews.title: Overrated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Alila Ubud certainly lives up to its 'pleasantly surprising' tagline.
reviews.title: Loved the resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007
reviews.text: My wife and I booked the "2 faces of Alila" - 2 nites at Ubud and 2 nites at Manggis in Jan 08 for their honeymoon package. While the locations are quite far from the bustling Kuta town (~1.5 hours from each location), the resorts are quiet and perfect for honeymooners who just want to spend time alone with each other.
reviews.title: Beautiful property; great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007
reviews.text: No tips are required at this resort as it is clearly stated in their handbook. But you will feel so appreciative of their excellent service that it would be an injustice if one doesn't do so.
reviews.title: Top Hotel Just Beware of Booking through Magic of the Orient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The swimming pool at Alila Ubud is rated as the top 50 in the world, and indeed you feel you are swimming among the canopy of the rainforest in the emerald pool. Do arrive early as there are limited deckchairs but please please do not hoard these if you do not intend to stay for long in the sun - "ie. do not reserve seats for later use"!!
reviews.title: Nothing special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007
reviews.text: Overall, our experiences have been great and we really want to thank the management for the excellent service they have inculcated in their staff - from the welcome reception at the airport to the departure formalities.
reviews.title: 99 Percent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The setting is beautiful and the views amazing but the public areas are too small. There were not nearly enough sunbeds by the pool, one afternoon I saw an elderly couple being shown to two mats laid on the concrete as there were no sunbeds available! We were quite lucky and always managed to get beds.
reviews.title: Luxury

likes.disliked: — The weak shower pressure and the taxi price (USD38)

reviews.title: Perfect
reviews.text: Everything you would expect was there, complimentary drinks by the pool, afternoon tea, nightly turndown, well appointed rooms and the service was generally very good if a little slow and lacking the refinement we'd found in Seminyak.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had our own car, which was really useful as the hotel is about 15 minutes out of town and the free shuttle only runs during the day. We loved Ubud and ate in some lovely restaurants, our favourite was Nomad, on the main road. We used the hotel as a base for exploring the area which worked well.
reviews.title: beautiul views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: Had a great time at the hotel. The staff are attentive and very helpful, nothing is too much trouble. Great place to chill out and relax but have the option to go in Ubud and surrounding areas to go shopping. Food in the hotel was very good, but a bit expensive. As a single traveller though when looking to eat in Ubud the restaurants there had minimum spend so pricing in the cost of taxi too and from Ubud the prices were not too exorbitant, The only downside was there was no literature in the rooms to find out what was going on and what trips/activities you could do unless you asked at the main desk (but my understanding was the new brochures were being compiled and printed). The spa has very good treatments and the people who organised the spa from the moment you register to the time you leave were very efficient and friendly.
reviews.title: Chill Out Zone

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's our Honeymoon - We stayed here for 5 days and continued to Alila Uluwatu for 3 days afterwards - I loooove Alila Ubud! Great service - Great amenities - and we experienced those monkeys playing with each other at the Pool area! We also had the experience to watch wayang show that they held at 1 one when we were there. I love the open air shower, I love the area. On the way to the hotel, we stopped at Ibu Andayani's warung and bought dinner since we were thinking about not going anywhere that night. And 4 thumbs UP! You guys should look for it! her nasi campur + bebek betutu is the bomb! She put together your meal with her bare hands - Totally clean I guarantee. We are travellers from California and we didn't get sick - Yes - we heard horor stories about eating in Indonesia! We stopped by there every night and brought back our dinner to the hotel room. And Yes - NO TV - but we do have free wireless internet! :) All and all - Very satisfied with everything and will be back very soon!
reviews.title: Soothing - Relaxing - Wait - It's Alila Ubud!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here 2 nights on our trip to Bali. We got a package beach + jungle and got an upgrade to a room on the ground floor with an open air bathroom. Beautiful! I felt completely whole with the jungle and the cute monkeys on the premises. The only downside is that the hotel is quite old and needs to be renovated. Especially the rooms are old and kind off musty. When we arrived, we got a special welcome drink and a staffmember showed us around the hotel. The swimming pool is for sure one of the most beautiful ones I have ever seen in my life! The breakfast @ Alila Ubud is Superb. You could chose from the menu and I really like the Indonesian breakfast with local specialties. The town of Ubud is very cosy and has lovely markets to buy local stuff. For sure worth a visit, I hope this hotel gets the facelift needed!
reviews.title: Amazing pool, gorgeous nature!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great resort, super quiet in a very relaxed environment, the views from pool side are stunning, this is a great place to get away with a loved one for some r&r prices are very good.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want to escape to Paradise, tada, you have arrived! The momment we arrived down the winding road of rice patties, ducks, private views, and awesome security, we new we were in for a treat.
reviews.title: A total and complete dream come true!! In love with the Alila!

description: Alila Ubud hotel is a tranquil and secluded hillside retreat that sits high up on the edge of the rich green Ayung River valley in Bali’s central foothills, in the traditional Balinese hill village of Payangan.The resort is located just minutes from Ubud, the island’s cultural heart. Blending contemporary design and traditional Balinese architecture, the secluded courtyards, spacious terraces and private gardens of our charming Ubud boutique hotel create an intimate feeling like none other.
